# GTKX

> GTKX is a framework for building native GTK4 desktop applications using React and TypeScript. It bridges React's component model with GTK4's native widget system, allowing you to write familiar React code that renders as native Linux desktop applications.

GTKX uses a custom React Reconciler to translate React's virtual DOM operations into GTK4 widget operations. You write React components using JSX, the GTKX reconciler converts React elements into GTK widget nodes, and TypeScript FFI bindings marshal calls to native GTK4 via Rust. GTK4 then renders native widgets on Linux.

Key features:

- Familiar React patterns: hooks, state, props, and components
- Hot Module Replacement (HMR) powered by Vite for instant code updates
- Native performance through direct FFI bindings to GTK4 via Rust and libffi
- CLI scaffolding with `npx @gtkx/cli@latest create`
- CSS-in-JS styling with Emotion-style API
- Testing utilities with Testing Library-style API

Packages:

- `@gtkx/cli`: CLI for creating and developing GTKX apps with HMR
- `@gtkx/react`: React reconciler and JSX components for GTK4 widgets
- `@gtkx/ffi`: TypeScript FFI bindings for GTK4, libadwaita, GLib, GIO, and more
- `@gtkx/css`: CSS-in-JS styling for GTK widgets
- `@gtkx/testing`: Testing utilities with queries, userEvent, and screen helpers

Prerequisites: Node.js 20+, GTK4, Linux, and optionally libadwaita for modern GNOME-style apps.

- [@gtkx/react API](https://eugeniodepalo.github.io/gtkx/docs/api/react): React components, render function, and utilities
- [@gtkx/css API](https://eugeniodepalo.github.io/gtkx/docs/api/css): CSS-in-JS template literals and styling functions
- [@gtkx/testing API](https://eugeniodepalo.github.io/gtkx/docs/api/testing): Testing queries, userEvent, and waitFor utilities
